title: why do I pay (weekdays) 50 cents for the SN outside the Food store but 50cents plus tax inside the store?
text:
I passed this along to our circulation folks. According to them,
newspaper sales are taxable under state tax laws, so retailers can
charge tax on the item. Some donÍt, in effect assuming the tax burden
even if the consumer isnÍt paying it directly, which is basically what
happens when you buy a copy out of a vending rack.
